description:
Position Description: Logistics Coordinator
     
      Reports to: Senior Manager, Freight Forwarding
      Location: Edmonton, Alberta
     
     
       BBE Expediting is seeking 
      a highly motivated individual to join our team as a Freight Forwarder! Your role will focus on delivering exceptional Customer Service to new and existing clients across a variety of industrial sectors including pharmaceuticals, government, and mining. The successful candidate will be
     
      responsible for sourcing transportation, negotiating rates, and developing shipping solutions across Canada. The successful applicant has experience in the industry, is solution driven, organized, has a high attention to detail and excellent customer service.
      BBE’s Vision BBE’s Core Values
      Supply Chain Partner, Innovation, Safety, Adaptability
      Networking the world Integrity & Team
     
      What you will be doing:
     
       Follow company health & safety standards and company policies and procedures.
       Create, analyze, and determine the best value options for our clients.
       Quote and arrange a variety of shipments, including straightforward A to B, complex solutions,
     
     
       multi modal and project specific.
     
     
       Organize pickup, delivery and close off files for billing in a timely manner.
       Arrange for consolidation of shipments.
       Provide timely updates to clients and stakeholders.
       Prioritization of shipments based on client requirements.
       Accurate and complete documentation.
       Timely and effective resolution of issues; damage, delays et al.
       Other duties as required and directed by your supervisor.
     
     
      Preferred Skills:
      
     
     
       Post-Secondary education; Business diploma/degree.
       Customer Service experience
       Two or more years of experience in Logistics or Freight Forwarding.
       Professional communication, presentation skills and project management experience
       SCMP or similar designation.
       CIFFA certification.
     
     
      Must haves:
     
       Must be a team player, a self-starter, a lover of learning.
       A success junkie, problem solver, techie, result measurer and/or status quo challenger.
       Strong organizational and time management skills, with a personal drive to succeed.
       The ability to exceed customer's expectations.
       Accountability to self, team, and clients
       Ability to easily adapt to changing market, client needs, and processes.
       Experience working in northern Canada.
     
     
      What BBE can offer you:
      
     
     
       Health Benefits after 3 months
       Hybrid work-from-home agreement after 6 months
       An environment that promotes continuous learning and training.
       Competitive wages.
